item.title: Sent down Veolia to clean streets. Didn't do it properly., 8th July
item.description:
Hi from Mr Webster, Today's date is the 8th of July 2025. Thank you for getting back to me.Pictures show on the 8th of July that nothing was swept properly. Roz Belghrous Contact Centre Manager Copy Dear Mr. Webster, I am writing in response to your recent email regarding street sweeping on your road. Veolia attended your location on 7th July 2025, and the street was swept As per usual, you were given 1/2 truth full of crap. answer. In accordance with the contractual standard. If you believe this has not been done correctly, It should be./It should read in accordance with the Lying. pieces of crap you have working for you. You are entitled to raise a formal complaint via the Haringey Council website, where it will be properly logged and investigated.Yeah, it's alright. However, I must make it absolutely clear that the language and tone used in your messages are unacceptable. good You know exactly what you can do with a chair leg. Our frontline crews and customer service staff are working hard to deliver essential services and support to all residents, No, they're not. That's called office workers spin. It's uni rubbish talk. And they do not deserve to be subjected to abuse, personal insults, or hostile remarks. ar den den poor little man . Woman tell them to pull their big boy pants and big girl pants on. We are here to help, No, that's not the case. Messing around, being stupid, acting stupid, talking stupid, that's the case. Example of this. You're more worried about the way I say something than what I'm actually saying.This e-mail is an example of that. But we will not tolerate repeated rudeness or disrespect Nor will I like when you and your staff lie all the time .Like when I send in pictures or cctv to you about what they haven't done, when they lie to you and say they have done it. Example today, the 8th of July, pictures from before showing nothing has been swept .Don't forget your guys work really hard to do what residents need and your frontline staff are full of it. I can show you the CCTV if you need to see exactly what your guys did.And not what they say they did. Please don't take my word for it, don't take the pictures. I send you or the CCTV. Come down yourself and have a look. Not a Monday or Thursday. Should this behaviour continue, we will be left with no choice but to cease direct communication. What communications? 9 times out of 10 I'm the one who asked to turn round and try and get you to do your job properly. People can't point the finger at me and say I lie, but they can about you and your cruise. We expect all correspondence to be respectful and constructive and we are committed to responding in kind. You're an office working uni. I'm not. Yours sincerely, PS Is your staff still going round stealing stuff from people? Https://youtu.be/VCrAYnC_vpc https://youtu.be/h3tot5L6FZw

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dorset Road, West Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cars parking and blocking D3 bus access, 8th July
item.description:
Following roadworks on Wapping Wall the yellow lines haven’t been painted back in and every day cars are parking and bikes are being parked outside Pelican Wharf building (58 Wapping Wall, E1W 3SL) which is blocking access for buses and some cars (especially due to the traffic island). I have video evidence. It’s happening every day. Please paint lines back in asap and mark this area no parking!

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Today, my neighbours threw a garden table onto my front porch and later dumped an office chair, without permission or reason. These actions were unprovoked and left a mess at the front of my property. This behaviour is unacceptable and needs urgent attention., 8th July
item.description:
On 8th July 2025, my neighbours threw a garden table onto my front porch without any permission or provocation (see attached photo). Later the same day, they also dumped an office chair, adding to the mess. These unprovoked actions have caused a disturbance and left the front of my property in a disorderly state. This repeated fly-tipping is unacceptable and needs to be dealt with promptly.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hillsboro Road, Dulwich Village, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road structure vibrating and moving when buses or heavy vehicles go down the road, 8th July
item.description:
When buses or heavy vehicles go down the road there is significant vibration which causes shaking within our property. This is likely to be causing structural damage. A Similar problem has previously been reported in relation to Sefton Road but appears now to be a problem for Sherborne Road. (When heavy vehicles like the R3 bus, go over this stretch of road (between houses 12-16 Sefton Road) the supporting structure beneath the tarmac is moving. This means there is excessive vibration/knocking and potential for damage to houses in the street. We can feel these vibrations and knocking in every room in our house I believe this will be causing possible damage to my property and others in the road and should be fixed urgently. The same problem has been previously identified and fixed properly e.g the area outside 21 Sefton Road)
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 28, Sherborne Road, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet
